title: HW 0
text:
In this tutorial, we will be plotting a scatterplot between the Palmer Penguins’ flipper lengths and body mass to see how they compare and differ across the 3 species.


First, we want to import pandas for data manipulation and seaborn for visualization.

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns




Using pandas, we can load in the Palmers Penguins dataset with URL below.

url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PhilChodrow/PIC16B/master/datasets/palmer_penguins.csv"
penguins = pd.read_csv(url)




Using pandas, we can subset the dataframe so that we have only the necessary components. In this case, we only need the columns: Species, Flipper Length (mm), and Body Mass (g)

df = penguins[["Species", "Flipper Length (mm)", "Body Mass (g)"]]




Using seaborn, we can plot the scatterplot easily by using seaborn.scatterplot and setting “Flipper Length (mm)” as the x-axis and “Body Mass (g)” as the y-axis.
In order to group the points by species, we and differentiate the points through shape and color by setting the parameters style and hue to “Species.”
Because the full species names are unnecessarily long, we can change the labels of the legend by accessing it through the code scatter.legend_ and setting new labels as shown below.

scatter = sns.scatterplot(x="Flipper Length (mm)", y="Body Mass (g)", style="Species", hue="Species", data=df)

# Access Legend
legend = scatter.legend_
new_labels = ['Adelie', 'Chinstrap', 'Gentoo']
legend.set_title('Species')
for t, l in zip(legend.texts, new_labels): t.set_text(l)
